item.title: People saying nice things about Civil Wardrobe
item.dc:creator: Brian Kirsten
item.content:encoded:
First from Don MacPherson:
There’s a key reason why Internet comics columnist Rich Johnston’s satire of Marvel super-heroes and the publisher’s late-shipping crossover event is so successful: it’s more than a satire of super-hero comics. Johnston takes aim at pop culture, politics, big-box commerce, celebrity-sponsored spirituality and so much more in this one-shot.
Then from the bad librarian (refering to Edmund Bagwell's page in the book):
This image is great on a couple of levels, not least because it really does sum up the way U.S. comic writers regard the U.K. - as defined by WWII, Benny Hill, punk rock, faddy pop, ill-defined mysticism and football hooliganism.
